div.p: Browser compatibility: All features tested on Chrome 5 (Win). Safari has some issues with YouTube embedding. Firefox mostly works although it's not extensively tested. IE is not supported.

ul.li: Click the search button below a selected node
Some images to insert are proposed to you based on the content of the node.
You can also use your own search terms.
Use the search menu to load a Google Maps widget to your node
The location of the map is saved together with the mind map.
It finally works!
Try dragging a node to another position in the tree.
Note that you can move whole branches this way.
Pasting a YouTube link causes a video to appear.
Arrows are now rendered using cubic splines
The maps have a different look and feel.
Action buttons now look different
There are more keyboard shortcuts.
Nodes feel more responsive (style changes on hover)
The node layout & rendering is now much faster.
You can now save your maps locally using HTML5 local storage.
The "Open" link in the top right corner allows you to open maps from cloud, open local maps, and delete maps
TinyMCE is now integrated into the app, providing first-class rich text editing.
Creating nodes and selecting them is less laggy (still a little bit too much jumpy for my taste)
You can now change the mind map title and it is constantly visible in the window.
There are neat buttons with icons instead text buttons for node actions.
You can now add siblings directly from sibling node selection
There is a context menu that contains options for the node is meant to contain the most complete of node actions.
When selecting a node, all child nodes of that node also get highlighted in a different color.
App cache manifest is now dynamically generated during compile time.
The app now requires Google Accounts login; you should see your email in the top right corner.
Try making your own mind map and click "Save to cloud"
Make some changes or reload the page, then click "Load from cloud"
The app can be loaded and used without an internet connection. Try disconnecting from the internet and then hitting refresh.
Notice the cloud features are disabled now.

p.strong: Better Layout, Undo Stack, Rich Text Formatting, Copy/Paste

ul.li: The nodes are now positioned on an AbsolutePanel, and their positions are calculated by the script. Left-hand side and right-hand sides are now supported.
After adding or deleting nodes, try undoing this (ctrl+z)
Nodes now can be edited using rich text editing. You can play with the B-I-U buttons, or paste some text from another webpage.
Try cutting (ctrl+x) and pasting (ctrl+v) nodes around. Copy is not implemented yet.
I abandoned the idea of porting this to SVG, because current method works well enough.
